linkedinOrgTeaser:
86% of marketers now use AI. Most are using it as a faster typewriter.

The real shift happening: AI agents that talk to each other.

NBCU just announced AI agents are executing live sports ad buys across linear TV and streaming. Not suggesting buys. Executing them.

The gap between "we use AI" and "AI makes us better" keeps widening.

New analysis on what separates the leaders from the followers.

#AgenticAI #MarketingStrategy #RetailTech #AIMarketing #MediaBuying
linkedinPersonalTeaser:
Something weird is happening in marketing right now.

86% adoption of AI tools. But most companies are just using it to make more stuff faster.

Meanwhile, NBCU has AI agents executing live sports ad buys. Agent-to-agent. Humans just sign off.

The question for 2026 is not whether you use AI. It is whether AI changes how you think - or just makes you faster at thinking the same way.

What is your honest assessment of where your org falls on that spectrum?
